@ParametersAreNonnullByDefault

Package se.softhouse.jargo

An argument and options parser for java

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    StringParser<T>
    Parses Strings into values of the type T.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Argument<T>
    Represents a supported Argument for a command line invocation.
    ArgumentBuilder<SELF extends ArgumentBuilder<SELF,T>,T>
    Responsible for configuring and building Argument instances.
    ArgumentBuilder.ArityArgumentBuilder<T>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.arity(int) and ArgumentBuilder.variableArity().
    ArgumentBuilder.CommandBuilder
    Builder for Commands.
    ArgumentBuilder.DefaultArgumentBuilder<T>
    A very simple version of an ArgumentBuilder, it's exposed mainly to lessen the exposure of the SELF_TYPE argument of the ArgumentBuilder.
    ArgumentBuilder.ListArgumentBuilder<BUILDER extends ArgumentBuilder.ListArgumentBuilder<BUILDER,T>,T>  
    ArgumentBuilder.MapArgumentBuilder<K,V>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.asPropertyMap().
    ArgumentBuilder.OptionArgumentBuilder
    An intermediate builder used by Arguments.optionArgument(String, String...)
    ArgumentBuilder.RepeatedArgumentBuilder<T>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.repeated().
    ArgumentBuilder.SplitterArgumentBuilder<T>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.splitWith(String).
    ArgumentBuilder.TransformingArgumentBuilder<F>
    An intermediate builder used by ArgumentBuilder.transform(Function).
    ArgumentExceptions
    Gives you static access for creating ArgumentExceptions.
    Remember that created exceptions are simply returned not thrown.
    Arguments
    Used as a starting point to create Argument instances.
    Command
    Commands automatically gets an invocation of execute when given on the command line.
    CommandLineParser
    Manages multiple Arguments and/or Commands.
    ForwardingStringParser<T>
    A Decorator class.
    ForwardingStringParser.SimpleForwardingStringParser<T>
    A ForwardingStringParser that uses an already created StringParser as its delegate.
    ParsedArguments
    Holds parsed arguments for a CommandLineParser.parse(String...) invocation.
    StringParsers
    Gives you static access to implementations of the StringParser interface.
    Usage
    Responsible for formatting usage texts for CommandLineParser.usage() and Arguments.helpArgument(String, String...).
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ArgumentException
    Indicates that something went wrong in a parsing.

Package se.softhouse.jargo Description

An argument and options parser for java

Glossary

  • Option a simple flag parameter such as "-l", created with Arguments.optionArgument(String, String...). Doesn't accept any Parameter
  • Parameter the second part of an Argument, parsed with a StringParser
  • Argument both the name and the parameter, such as "--numbers 1,2,3"
  • Named Argument an argument with a name such as "--numbers"
  • Indexed Argument an argument without a name, such as "file_to_build" in "buildProgram file_to_build"
  • CommandLineParser Understands how to manage several Arguments

Examples

See CommandLineParser, Arguments, ArgumentBuilder for how to use this API

Localization

Arguments.integerArgument(String...), Arguments.longArgument(String...) and so on, formats and parses numbers in a Locale sensitive way.

Inspiration (a.k.a Credits)

If you recognize any features in this API it may come from:
  • git - the Command feature, suggestions for invalid arguments
  • maven - executing several commands
  • jcommander - almost everything else (this is what I based the feature set on)
